title: Print and format setvalues — s3-setvalues-print
text: format print methods setvalues S3 class. output vary depending child class/set type ("finite", "interval" "sequence").

title: Print and format setvalues — s3-setvalues-print
code: # S3 method for setvalues format(x, ...)  # S3 method for setvalues print(x, ...)

title: Print and format setvalues — s3-setvalues-print
text: x setvalues Object formatted printed. ... arguments passed format() method.

title: Print and format setvalues — s3-setvalues-print
text: format returns character vector, print returns invisible(NULL) (purely side-effects).

title: Print and format setvalues — s3-setvalues-print
code: format(setvalues_finite(c(0, 1))) #> [1] "A \"setvalues\" object of type \"finite\" with properties:" #> [2] "values: 0\n1"                                               print(setvalues_interval(0, Inf)) #> A "setvalues" object of type "interval" with properties: #> from: 0 #> to: Inf #>

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: Functions specifying creating objects class setvalues input values field set. also 3 child classes, "finite", "interval" "sequence".

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: values numeric Vector values representing finite set. numeric Lower bound interval. numeric Upper bound interval. sequence_function function function one argument (representing previous value) constructing sequence. initial_value function Initial value sequence.

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: object (s3) class c(type, "setvalues"), type one "finite", "interval", "sequence".

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: following three types set values available: setvalues_finite() finite sets example:  {0,1}{0, 1}{0,1} setvalues_interval() continuous intervals real domain, example:  [0,8)[0,\infty)[0,8) setvalues_sequences() sequences countably infinite cardinality, defined recurrence relations :  +1=f()withinitialvaluea0a_{n+1} = f(a_n) \text{\:\:initial\:value\:} a_0an+1=f()withinitialvaluea0 example:  Ncanbeconstructedwithf(x)=x+1anda0=0\mathbb N \text{\:can\:\:constructed\:\:} f(x) = x + 1 \text{\:\:} a_0 = 0Ncanbeconstructedwithf(x)=x+1anda0=0 Note: exhaustive sufficient purposes package (.e. simple sets represent support allowable parameter values distribution).
